intro: Brassica humilis var. nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemed mustard, is a small, annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, leafless stems that bear clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has simple, alternate leaves that are often lobed or serrated. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The flowers are followed by small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
